reviews.review_msg: Loves his job, pretty fun and lectures are super helpful. Lots of material medium difficulty so takes a good amount of work, exams are fair but hard. Decent amount of assignments etc to get your grade up a bit. (BUS 251)
One of the best Financial Accojntjng teachers you can get. GOAT. All I can say.
Not an easy course but way more tolerable than I expected. Richard was a big reason for that. Hope he teaches more courses at SFU!

Great tax prof - I had heard terrible things about tax prior to taking it. Tax is tough - but Richard made it more bearable. Be careful, there are 2 Richard Wong's that BUS courses @ SFU. One teaches accounting, the other teaches computing systems. I almost unenrolled b/c of the ratings on RateMyProfs. But you'll want to go look him up at UBC.

Scott is a good professor. He explains concepts and explains clearly what he is going to test on. For the midterm and the final he will send out a list of topics to review and if you can understand those, you are golden. His tests are fair and he's super helpful when you go to him as well.

Chris was an amazing professor, especially during his first semester ever of teaching. There are tons of concepts to remember, and it can be overwhelming, but use the textbook as reference and KEEP UP with the practice questions (do it over and over to study). Exams are lengthy and mostly calculations, but Chris lets you know exactly what is on it.
